While that price tag will make me pause before going there, what I really didn't appreciate was that the marina (skinless chicken breast) cost more than the original which actually includes more meat (breast + thigh).  I didn't need or want the larger quantity of food, but I did want my chicken without skin.  I understand there is a small additional cost in the form of manual labor, but really?  It seemed like it was just "demand" pricing - they are expecting more people to order that so they priced it higher.  I guess if others feel like I do, the market won't bear it and they'll have to change.  Or, the market will bear it, and good for their business.
author: Sara E.

description:
4.5 stars for sure. they had their soft opening today. I have  had the Marina location booked forever to try since thy opened. However, over the weekend I saw this sign go up by mi casa. They took over the old Urban Picnic and its refreshing. They add a different line up to the food scene in SOMA for lunch. Still the same simple 4 item menu but yet so delish. I got the Paleo with breast and a poached egg. A little price at almost $20 for chicken, broccoli, and an egg but it was clean and healthy. It came with broth too which props to them of it not tasting like oil water. 

will def be back.
author: Tao Tao W.

description: I decided to come here because I was searching for a restaurant that accommodated my paleo diet. I must say, I was very impressed by how much flavor such a simple dish could have! Growing up in a Chinese household, I was accustomed to having this type of steamed chicken so I didn't think it would impress me too much. But DAT SAUCE THO. Game changer. I wish I still worked in SF because this is the perfect little lunch spot in SoMa with plentiful seating in the cute, little courtyard.
author: Sharon I.

description:
In the former Urban Pinic space and so happy that it is there.

I am use to Singaporean Chicken and Rice, but R & R is a happy addition to the SOMA area. A standard original chicken and rice, is about $11.95 (make sure you get a poached egg for an extra +2), and get the hot sauce they have there because it is amazking.

It comes with chicken over rice and a side of cucumbers and a soybean sauce is the best for a lunch in soma (and with the hot sauce on the side).

I love that it comes with some chicken soup/broth for the cold weather and the food comes out without a long wait. Food is in a compostable container and the portion is generous. I will have to try it with brown rice and the paleo version (without rice).
author: Mei L.

description: I am excited to have found this place which serves one of my favorite all time dishes. It's not at the same level as what you'd eat in Thailand or Singapore, but until I go travel back to SE Asia,  I am happy to have this Americanized option nearby.
author: Rumi R.

description:
Thai style steamed chicken served with broth and soy ginger sauce. Very much a San Francisco spin on the Thai original, R&R serves their organic Mary's chicken over (optionally) brown rice in a compostable takeout container. A far cry from the street food traditionally  presented in a plastic bag!

That said, the preparation is delicious. A lover of chicken thighs personally, I recommend "the classic." The $2 poached egg add on is very good but I don't think necessary given how much sauce the dish comes with. 

Don't be deterred by the line; since they only serve essentially one thing it moves very quickly. Also, in case you're wondering, this place is not a good option for vegetarians. 

My one gripe (and subtracted star) is the high price point. $12-15 for lunch is too high. If in a closer location to home I'd definitely consider this place for dinner. Until then -- or when they realize they can get away with serving Safeway $0.99/lb thighs -- I'll keep this one on my list as a splurgy lunch.
author: Stephanie T.

description:
Tried this place for the first time and it was pretty good! I got the original with an egg and a bottle of Thai tea. My coworker got the original and an orange Fanta. For the both of us, the total came out to be $37 and I thought that was pretty pricy... I'm originally from LA so I'm a bit biased because I've had better hainan chicken and rice. The only unique part of this meal that differentiates the Thai style from the Chinese style is the dipping sauce.. and in my case I wouldn't mind having either one. 

We wen during lunchtime at around 1130am and beat the line. Chicken was tender, no bones, rice was flavorful and it also came with a cup of soup!

Overall, I was pretty satisfied with my meal and the portion sizes were also just right. I would probably come back and eat this again but not anytime soon.
author: Amy L.

description: I like this place when I want to have a heathy meal.  It is just steamed chicken on rice and vegetable.  Although the chicken is steamed, it doesn't taste dry.  The source included is very tasty.  It is a bit pricy for such simple dish.  But everything in San Francisco is pricy now.
author: Jon W.

description:
Ever had Nong's Khao Man Gai in Portland?  It's considered the best khao man gai around. I PERSONALLY think Rooster and Rice has wayyyyyyyyy better and  more flavorful chicken and rice. Super
Tender and teeming with flavor. The only toss up?  I think they could use some work on their sauce. But still bomb ass heck.
author: Chai S.

description: This place is amazing! I've been trying to make it here for the longest time and happened upon it on my way to the 24hr gym. I wasn't even hungry, but got the original, and added an egg. The check came out to close to $15.  You have to add an egg. It was cooked perfectly! That dipping sauce was soooooo good with the chicken and rice. Everything was awesome. I highly recommend trying this place out. I'll definitely be back!
author: Julia C.

description: Not great compared to the Hainan chicken food truck in Portland. Let down for me and the line was way too long. Also expensive! Rice was overcooked (mushy).
author: Carol C.

description:
I love love love Rooster & Rice! I didn't know about this location until my friend took me here for lunch one day! 

I was so glad we were able to beat the crowd because there was a huge line right after we order. But, the line does move fast from what I've seen. 

Just like their Fillmore location, their original chicken rice did not disappoint! The flavors were all there, the sauce was delicious, and the broth was full of flavors! I recommend trying the habanero sauce if you like spicy. It definitely adds a kick to your meal.

Overall, this is a great spot for lunch, dinner, or whenever you're hungry. It's a little pricey (being about $13 without add-ons), but the quality is great and the food is absolutely delicious. Can't wait to come back!
author: Wendy Y.

description: Rooster and rice is the perfect fast casual meal, the chicken broth is so good that I have to order two every time. You can't go wrong with the original hunan chicken!
author: Betty B.

description: YES it's that good the "original" is delicious with tender chicken over fragrant Jasmine rice and a side of chicken broth. It's unfortunate the location is embedded into a building hard to find but if you're near by its worth a one time try.
author: N A.

description:
Bland, plain, and overpriced.  

I wouldn't believe it's  $14+ for some steamed tasteless chicken and brown rice, except.. thanks SOMA.

Avoid. Plain home baked chicken, with nothing, is far more interesting and satisfying.
author: Calvin R.

description:
I live nearby, and this is my go-to dinner spot when I'm feeling too lazy to cook but still want something reasonably healthy! I love the paleo option (chicken + vegetables) with some delicious chicken stock on the side! Their ginger dipping sauce is A++, and the small courtyard area outside is really cute as well! 

I just wish this place wasn't as pricy, but I'm used to cheap Hainan chicken from Asia. This place definitely does hainan chicken justice though!
author: Maria Y.

description: I love the food here! It is a bit on the expensive side and sometimes the wait is long. It gets busy during the Fidi lunch rush (as expected) but with very few menu variations, you'd expect the food to be expedited faster. As for the food, the chicken is very juicy and tender and cooked simple but flavorful. Delicious!
author: Shiela D.

description: I've now tried khao mun gai at a few places in SF (you could say I'm a little obsessed), and hands down Rooster & Rice is above and beyond the best. The broth, rice, and chicken quality (not to mention quantity) are all better than the likes of Hawker Fare and Lers Rhos. I just wish they were on more delivery platforms like UberEATS-- the only reason I even tried those other khao mun gais is because R&R is only available on Caviar, with absurd delivery minimums (and the restaurant itself is rather far), or else I swear I would be eating R&R at least 3x/week. I'm obsessed.
author: Minnia F.

description:
Tender chicken cooked competently and stacked on top of rice. Add a tad of special soy sauce and spicyness. What's not to like?

Pointers: don't add the soy sauce thing all at once. Ration conservatively. The sauce is pretty potent and they were very generous with the amount they give you.
author: Jason W.

description: Great place for lunch. Traditional thai chicken and rice. I had the paleo style without the rice. The chicken was extremely juicy and tender and the chili garlic soy sauce was absolutely decadent. I didn't love the fact that the accompanying veggies were basically broccoli. I felt like they could have been a little more creative there. The broth was also delicious, but there were no spoons to eat it. So I wasn't sure if it was a stew or like a juice? It was alright. Nothing to talk about.
author: Ashmita V.

description:
I was craving Khao Man Gai in Portland and I found this little gem close to my work.  I ordered the original and the paleo Togo.  


The thigh meats were so soft, juicy and tender. The skin was just perfect--in my mouth. The broth was crisp, clean and enhances the flavour of the entire dish.  

It's one of my favourites. Super healthy.  Great tasting and very filling. If you're looking for a quick bite without the guilt of unhealthy calories this is your place.  If you're looking for something that comes close to home, this is your place.
author: Peter N.

description:
Eh, A-OK sounds about right for this place, mostly due to the price.

Came late on a Monday (~7:00PM), and ordered a paleo style (mixed breast and thigh meat) with an egg. The sauce that came with the chicken was quite flavorful, the broth that came with the food was quite good as well, and the star of the show (chicken) was tender and tasted quite good. All that combined with the fact that this place seems like a healthy option made it a fairly decent meal overall.

That being said, however, this place is pretty (quite) expensive. At $13 for poached chicken over broccoli, it's quite the premium to pay even by SF FiDi standards. If I ever come back I'm getting a Marina; I found that the paleo style dish wound up with a bunch of juices and no rice-like component to soak them up! Oh, and I'm also going to skip the egg next time. Even though it was cooked quite runny (goes well with the dish I think), I think the additional $2 is not worth it.

As an aside, this place has napkins and togo boxes branded with their logo..!
author: Alexander L.

description:
Super surprised how such a simple dish (chicken and rice) could taste so damn good! They give you a lot of chicken, so you will definitely be full. I love their small menu; absolutely hate it when there are too many options to choose from. 

And this is located in the best area for lunch. Plenty of outdoor seating to enjoy your food before dragging yourself back to work.
author: S. S.

description: Delicious, light and healthy. Also open late which is a plus. Delivery available by caviar which makes this an easy weeknight dinner choice when I'm too lazy or don't have time to cook. Located in the 303 plaza with the big fountains and the Lee's deli also in the plaza.
author: Alias A.

description: Simple and incredibly delicious is all you want when it comes to Asian chicken and rice and this place is both. I got the original with an added egg because, duh. The poached chicken was tender and delicious, the rice tasted like it was cooked in chicken fat for 20 days because it was so tasty and the sauce was salty, sweet and brought everything together. The broth was a good palette cleanser that was smooth and warm. Also, all their napkins, lids and bags have their signature chicken on them--so cute! Definitely coming back...everyday...for every meal.
author: Tina P.

description:
I grew up in an area some pretty amazing Hainan chicken rice, and I'm so excited that this is on par with the stuff from home, in addition to being walking distance from my office!

Rooster & Rice serves the Thai variation of Hainan chicken rice. The meal consists of tender pieces of chicken served over a bed of chicken-flavored rice with a side of cucumbers, a cup of chicken broth, and a gingery, garlicky soy sauce for heavy dipping. There are two other sauces (one tangy and another spicy) you can serve yourself.

While it's a tad more expensive than what I get back home, the price is pretty standard for a lunch in the area. I'd also rather spend that money on $10-12 on some delicious, hearty meat and rice than on a couple of leaves at a salad place to be honest!

Can't wait to get it again!
author: Derick N.

description:
Let's get one thing straight -- this is NOT hainan chicken rice. This place serves THAI style chicken rice but it IS delicious.

I came by during lunch to get two originals to-go (one for me and one for the husband).  Opened the box and it looked kinda sad. Chicken is white, rice is white, parsley is green, and three 1/2 slice of cucumbers. Probably not sad but a but a bit too healthy for my palete.  I felt sad looking at the box but I was hungry so I started eating...

DAYAAAAAAAM the rice is good. Yes, it's the garlic flavored chicken rice.  The texture is perfect. I ate about half of all the rice before I picked up the chicken because it looked boiled :*(  I don't like boiled chicken. My dog doesn't even like boiled chicken (no, she actually does like boiled chicken...she likes eveything). But then I noticed the little sauce container. It contained some tasty dipping sauce - yummy and delicious! Like soy sauce with spices and seasoning. 

So $12.95 isn't cheap but it is worth it.  The portions are quite large and... most importatly.. remember this is SoMa and salads are like $15 each.
author: Virginia L.

description: it's sooo good.  if you like tender chicken, rice with an essence of chicken, and garlic ginger sauce. you must try it.
author: golf g.

description:
Yay for khao mun gai aka Thai chicken rice aka hainan chicken (they all taste the same to me haha but maybe I just don't know any better)! Finally a place around the area that sells a decent version of this dish. It's not the best kind I've ever had but it'll happily satisfy my craving. Also a bit pricey for what it is but welcome to SF I guess.

I order The Original and it comes with a mix of light and dark meat along with white rice (cooked in chicken broth). Make sure to pour some of the herb-y soy sauce over the chicken to give it some flavor. The portion size is alright. I can finish it all without a problem and be full and satisfied but not overstuffed. A guy with a bigger appetite might be a bit more unsatisfied. If you need a little more food or want a more balanced meal, add some extra veggies. The meal also comes with bone broth soup which is simple but tasty. 

Good healthy choice for lunch/dinner! Wish it was closer to my office as I can only get it when I splurge for delivery.
author: Tiffany S.

description: It takes me 20 mins to walk here from where I live, and yet I've made it a habit to visit at least once every week, because it's just so worth it. No place in SF serves up a better Hainan Chicken. Get The Marina or The Paleo if you feel like something healthier, but for me it'll always be The Original!
author: Carl W.

description: A place to be when craving some chicken, rice, and soup. This serving that you order is worth your wild because its a different style of Asian cooking which serves up with a great sauce as well to have with your chicken. Although it is pretty pricey, I think it is worth your money to get this as it fills you up for lunch and maybe till dinner time.
author: Brittany L.

description: There are about four lunch options to choose from. "Looks" plain, probably simple if you like crazy flavors, but don't be fooled. Chicken is very juicy and tender with a ton of flavor. Rice is equally delicious and marinated. The ginger soy sauce it comes with makes the meal so much better. Each meal comes with a chicken broth, great for cold days.
author: Marfel L.

description: Awesome!  Similar to Nong's in Portland -- and possibly even better.  Folks in SF are lucky to have a couple locations to choose from.  Rooster & Rice reminds me of yet another "food truck turned mini-shop" venture.  Seems many are taking advantage of the current order-take-out-and-sit-in phenomena.  My colleague and I enjoyed sitting outside on this particular day, though, as we were experiencing a break in the winter storms that have saturated the state.  I didn't realize there was a difference in rice between the menu options, but I think I had the Original with regular white rice.  There's not much else to provide in a review, other than just bookmark and go try it sometime!  Counter service was quick and friendly, and after that you take care of your own sauces and utensils while waiting to pick up your compostable bowl of freshly-made and perfectly proportioned protein and carbs (and for some of you, veggies).
author: Sherri C.

description:
I don't get it. Prime example of SF overzealousnsess..attempting to modernize traditional foods with a heavy price tag to trick clueless yuppies. 

The chicken was pretty disappointing..and far from than the dozens of chinatown eateries that serve poached chicken. I will give props to the interesting sauces..but you can't just add some rice and slices of cucumber and call it a day.
author: Howe L.

description: Delicious poached chicken and rice with a side of chicken broth, broccoli and cucumbers - a wonderful meal any time! As I like to finish off my meals with tea or something hot, I was very surprised at how the chicken broth complemented the rice and chicken so well. Highly recommended.
author: Erik S.

description: It is 99% similar to traditional Chinese food "Hainan Jifan", don't quite like the fact it puts "Thai" as style here. The food is very good, just like the ones I had in China, the other thing I don't like is it is closed during night and weekend.
author: Kelvin Y.

description:
wow! just caviared my fiancé and my dinner for Wednesday night late dinner! I got the original and the marina with extra breast meat for the bae. the meat texture was chewy, just the right amount - what was amazing was the gingery soy sauce it came with the dish! can someone please share with me how I can make this at home?!?!  

so glad to have found this place! will def be a regular
author: holly n.

description: The food is not cooked bad which is why I gave it one star. But it's sooo plain. Since it's "Thai" I was expecting some seasoning, maybe some curry or peanut sauce. Nope. It's literally a scope of plain rice, a scoop of plain broccoli and a scoop of plain tofu ( I got the vegetarian). No salt no sauce  no seasoning no nothing. If you want the most bland bowl of food in San Francisco try this place.
author: Jeanine K.

description:
What a phenomenally mediocre place for lunch. For $15, you can get dry chicken over cold rice and a half assed attempt at a fried egg and no drink. 

Just go to the food trucks. For $15 you can get better and more interesting food for your dollar. 

I'm so upset I waited for 20 minutes for this crap.
author: Cody R.

description: Juicy chicken, aromatic rice, flavorful chicken broth, variety of sauces - what else could a girl ask for? Love this place so much and will keep coming back! When I can spend $15 on this (the same price as my salad) and be much fuller and happier eating it, that's not a bad trade off! Wish they would open on weekends!!
author: Cynthia H.

description:
I've been to the new location a few times since it's opened, and haven't been left disappointed yet. The menu is simple, clean, and delicious. The portion size is considerable, but never leaves me feeling bloated, and the service is quick -- perfect for that lunch during work hours. When a spot like this has only a few items on their menu, you can be sure that they've perfected the recipe for each dish. 

Having traveled to Thailand a few times, I can say without a doubt this is the best Khao Mun Gai I've come across in the States. Of course it's a bit more pricey than the Khao Mun Gai you might find in Sukhumvit, but you're paying for quality and service -- from my understanding the chicken, rice, and vegetables are all organic. 

I've eaten everything here except the tofu, which I imagine will be just as good as the chicken for you tofu eaters. I usually add extra cilantro to my dish, because I'm that type of dude. Enjoy!
author: Tyler W.

description:
I was so happy to find out that there was a Rooster&Rice 1 block from my office! Yay for more (Asian) options. The place is small and trendy. I got in line right before 12 and had to wait about 10 minutes for my dish. By the time I left, the line was twice as long. 

I got the "original" and it definitely filled me up. Pricing is aligned with SF..it came out to be $13 with tax. The menu is limited and simple. It's basically just rice and chicken. It does come with a broth but I'm not sure how "healthy" it is. There is limited seating inside but it looked like majority of people were getting it to go.

I didn't have too much interaction with the workers but they seemed friendly. There are also 2 handsome men working here so that's a plus if you're single, haha!

I would definitely come back again!
author: Megan L.

description: A simple, healthy option for lunch. The menu is a bit one note...but the broth always hits the spot!
author: Mimi T.

description:
It's a bit pricey, but it makes sense since it's in SoMa and the quality is great! I'm used to eating the chicken rice that my mom makes and I know that the sauce really sets Thai style chicken rice apart from other chicken rice dishes. 

This being said, Rooster & Rice does *not* disappoint! I've been here twice and have been satisfied both times. 

Couple tips: 
- It's super busy at lunch time. Come either right before the noontime rush, or wait until ~12:40 or so to place your order
- The portion is generous! Either share w/ a friend or eat half for lunch and the other half for dinner/an afternoon snack :9
author: Nadine F.

description: Cool concept. They have a nice brand/stamp. The chicken skin was slimy and there was a lot of it. And it took forever. Still it's really good overall and unique.
author: Andrew K.

description:
I've visited the Marina location and realize they opened one up near my work. YAY!

It's a simple dish, of thai chicken and rice. Think Chinese Hainan chicken but with different sauces, and fragrant rice. The difference maker is the hot sauce on the side, really makes it worth going to. The one they provide is a mix between the original and bold, and it's pretty darn good. You can buy a bottle of it as well. The dish also comes with a small cup of chicken broth and cilantro/green onion. Goes well with the dish. You can either pour it on or drink it solo. 

They had some fried chicken skin pieces to sample as well, and it was delicious. Anything fried is usually amazing. 

It's a little pricey, but in the FiDi, it's kind of expected. I can't remember if the prices were cheaper out in the Marina, but I feel like they would be. 

I'll be back!
author: Jeannie L.

description: Love Rooster and Rice!  Skinless chicken with brown rice is healthy and filling. Perfect quick lunch or dinner. Always get hot sauce to add to your meal to make it extra spicy.
author: Christina Z.

description:
I'm so glad this place opened in soma. I had been to the marina location once and it was great but the marina is so far away for a place that is barely a sit down joint. Anyway so glad it opened it's new location. There is a decent amount of seating inside, one long group table for about 12, and then some bench seating along the window. They rely on everyone going to eat outside in the plaza seating. 
The menu is really straight forward chicken and rice: original version, chicken breast version, vegetable (no chicken), and I think I saw a paleo version (chicken and veggies, no rice). The extras would be an egg, extra chicken, sauce, rice, and soup. 
I love chicken and rice and I've tried to make my own at home and damn is it a lot of work. It's a lot a lot of work. That's why while it is more expensive than I'd like to spend for a quick lunch meal, it's def worth it. It's also a really hearty portion. They give you a lot of chicken - no bones! - and the rice is flavorful, broth tasty, sauce is awesome. It'll definitely fill you up. Definitely coming back and I'm so excited to have it in the neighborhood.
author: Veronica L.

description: This was my first time checking out Rooster & Rice.  It's a great lunch spot if you're looking for a solid meal.  I got here a little before noon and luckily I did because the line started getting longer after I ordered.  I got the Marina and it was a very healthy portion.  The flavors were great and I added some siracha for a nice kick.  Only complaint was that I had some bones/skin on my chicken and it is expensive.  Otherwise it was very good.
author: Blake B.

description: Chicken and rice is my favorite! I'm so excited that they finally opened. The chicken is soft, tender, and juicy!  Add an egg  for extra yummy ness! The lunch crowd is lively, so come early. The line is fast, so waiting is not an issue. Lots of seating inside and outside. I definitely will be back and highly recommend to everyone!
author: Sandy L.

description: Yum. Expensive but it's better than no Hainan Chicken :) This is as good as it gets in the Bay Area.
author: Lyn X.

description:
So good, I almost didn't write a review because I don't want more people coming and the line getting longer.

I had the Original. Chicken was juicy, broth is delicious.
author: Stephanie C.

description: Can't beat this place! Khao mun gai is one of my favorite foods when in Thailand and these guys are as authentic as it gets down to the minimal wait time for the food.
author: Rolf C B.

description: My team recently ordered lunch from here via Caviar, per a recommendation from a coworker. I don't eat meat, so I got the vegetarian dish. For a place that specializes in chicken, the vegetarian option was surprisingly good! The ginger soy sauce/glaze and broth really heighten the flavor so I would recommend adding both. I wish the tofu had it's own seasoning, but it was just plain and bland. I also would have liked to see more vegetables than just broccoli. The website says "seasonal vegetables" but surely there are more vegetables in season than just broccoli.
author: Ariana M.

description: I guess I'll be the voice of reason. I've given this place a chance numerous occasions. The truth is, it's overpriced and lacks taste. If you want to spend 15 bucks on boiled chicken and plain brown rice go for it. Then again, there are a lot of suckers in SF.
author: Mehr E.

description: Chicken was poached very well. House sauce was delicious. Rice was a bit soggy. Overall the food was great.
author: Tony H.

description: I've always been a fan of Rooster & Rice ever since the beginning. I made sure to drive out of my way to pick up their signature khao mun gai for dinner even though it was all the way up in Fillmore. The owner is super nice and I visited so many times that he remembered my name. I was super excited when R&R opened in Soma because it's so much more accessible! However, I'm not sure if it's the staff or the owner not being there all the time, but the chicken rice here is just not as good. Same sauce and same rice but the chicken really varies. Sometimes it's super dry but their sauce is consistent so I usually just pour the entire thing over the chicken. That usually helps with the dryness. Overall, still love R&R but I prefer the Fillmore location!
author: Grace C.

description: Wow! Chicken taste so fresh and the was so good! I'll recommend it to anyone who loves chicken
author: Tirso D.

description:
the food was really great, short wait time
(also there was a cute guy that was walking in and out of the kitchen)
would definitely return for the food (and the guy)
author: Melody W.

description:
A bit pricey (just like lunch almost anywhere in SF SoMa/FiDi lol), but a tasty meal nonetheless. It was my first time trying this dish so I don't anything to reference it against, but the chicken was soft and moist. The dipping sauce went well with it, but I really enjoyed the rice. It was very flavorful and complemented the dish. Get it with an egg! 

I don't plan to frequent this place, but if coworkers decide to check it out I wouldn't mind going again.
author: Eduardo R.

description:
Today is Trump's Inauguration day. So I needed something really good for lunch. Something that reminds me that life is worth living. 

I hopped on Yelp and saw that the Urban Picnic was replaced by Rooster & Rice, a place I had seen opened in the Marina, and now here it is - 2 blocks away from my work. Yay!

Upon arriving at Rooster & Rice, i see the line. I expected this as San Franciscans are crazy. I don't usually like lines. Some people go just for the line, it seems, but I stay away. This is the first time, I actually stood in the line. I dunno... maybe it's because today the world is ending. I mean if the US is going to try something new - like elect a fascist, xenophobic, racist, sexist imbecile, then I can also try something new. Like stand in a line.

Upon entry into the actual restaurant, I noticed that it was all asians and their more experimental non-asian friends. I don't know if I had ever seen so many asians in any other SOMA restaurant before. If Trump wanted to put all asians in an internment camp, they can make Rooster & Rice it's capital. He can just fence us all in like chickens.

Anyhow, I got the original. DUH. the OG of course. Jesus - the marina? Really? I'm not judging. I'm just saying... I'm judging.

Everything was pretty good and satisfying. As expected. The best thing was the broth which was super flavorful. Rice had a light flavor, which is fine. (Not as good as Hainanese chinese chicken, but it's fine.) Khao Mun Gai chicken is poached, where as Hainanese chicken is steamed - but end result is similar. Basically a very clean, chickeny flavor. 

This is why only the most experimental of non-asians would ever come here - that poached chicken. I think it's something you grow up with. To the non-asians, it's just rubbery and too chickeny. There's a reason why chicken is battered and fried. Or smothered with bbq sauce. I actually don't love chicken ...but there is something nostalgic about eating poached / steamed chicken. Very comforting. 

The ginger-soy sauce was of course delicious. You gotta have that right. I could talk about hainanese chicken sauce (which is a ginger scallion sauce), but I might have a gang of thai techies come beat me with a coconut hammer. 

(Aww.... don't get mad my Thai cousins... If it's any consolation, the Chinese don't do any noodle dishes as close to delicious as Tom Yum Noodle Soup.... mmmmm... Tom Yum Noodle Soup.)

Anyhow... seriously I'd say the only reason I am giving it 4 stars is because it's not Hainanese Chicken Rice. And I know that's not fair. But you know what... Today, a person who lost the popular vote by 2 million votes is being sworn into office. So life isn't fair. 

Maybe I'll update the review when life is fair again.
author: Bonnie H.

description: Chicken and rice is definitely my choice of comfort food whenever I go back to my parents' place. Rooster and Rice's version of this dish was very tasty. It was a bit on the pricier side but the rice and chicken was delicious. They also had many different types of sauces that were excellent garnishes for the chicken. I do wish they had something spicier though. If it were not so far from my work, I would have come here at least once a week!
author: Catherine T.

description: The quality of the food was good but the price seems a bit outlandish. Not sure I'd go back based on the price. It's chicken and rice after all!
author: Shawn P.

description: 4 Stars on the food.  3 Stars for the value.  The chicken and sauce over rice are pretty excellent.  I couldn't help wanting some greens to even it out though.  You can order a side of vegetables for $2 more, but given the already high starting price of $12-14, kind of starts taking you into a price range where the expectations should be much higher.
author: Chris T.

description:
Glad to see that Rooster & Rice has opened up a location in the SoMa area.

I recommend ordering "The Original" and adding the sous vide egg to go with it. The portions are very filling and the ginger/garlic sauce that comes with the meal is delicious. The meal includes a chicken broth to help wash the meal down.

They have some seating inside and plenty of seating outside.

I'll definitely be adding this spot to my lunch rotation.
author: Lester W.

description: I love this new location! The owners/employees there are super friendly. Nice modernized seating and a good vibe with music in the background. Simple menu with SUPER GOOD food. I get "The Marina" which is skinless chicken over brown rice. Add and egg and splash the sauce over your plate and you're good to go. Definitely eating here again and again. HIGHLY RECOMMENDED!!!
author: Alvin S.

description:
I received the wrong order. I ordered an original to go and got chicken with broccoli only, no rice. It was a bit disappointing to discover this after I got back to work and I didn't have enough time to go back and exchange it. 

The chicken is ok but what I like most is the rice and unfortunately for my order today there wasn't any.
author: Laura G.

description: This place is soooooo good. I wish it was just a LITTLE bit closer to where I live. I always get the original but with only dark meat. The chicken is SO good and tender and has so much flavor. The rice also has a lot of flavor and the combination of the chicken and rice is literally magical. The sauce they provide is also so yummy and brings the rice/chicken to the next level. The broth is also really good. YUMM. now i'm just craving rooster and rice.......
author: Stephanie W.

description:
My new favorite place for lunch in the area! Simple looking menu with fresh ingredients. The broth is something I've been thinking about on these cold and rainy days. 

I'd spring for the egg and get a sprinkle of their fried chicken skin. The other options are breast meat and brown rice. 

So the last couple times I've either opted for chicken breast and brown rice as an option. Just make sure you get the sauce (not spicy) and the broth that comes on the side!
author: Rob M.

description:
Food: 4/5
Service: 2/5

The chicken with jasmine rice is so simple but so flavorful. Add an egg to make it even more amazing. 

Everytime I order I need to order like 5 lunches and to drive it to another location like 40mins away (SF to Hayward). So, I call in right when they open at (11:30am) to make sure it doesn't mess up with their lunch flow. On both accounts, this is how the conversation goes.
Waiter (W): "Hi, Rooster and Rice may I help you?"
Me (M); "I'd like to place an order."
W: "uhhhhh hold on a minute."
Puts me on hold
W: "How many are you planning to order?"
M: "5."
W: "Well it messes up our lunch flow when we do take-out orders. We rather you come by and order."
**Me thinking: efficiency..lots to do..Got a dog with me that can't go in, hard to find good parking there without getting broken into.**
M: "Why do you have a phone number if you don't have take-out?" 
W: " We can do take out, just not at the time you want it bc it's during our lunch hour and our staff in the back cannot make all of the boxes quick enough"
**Me thinking: seems like it's a management issue or someone in the kitchen not being capable, unsure which.**

I was able to place my order, but each time it's been rough. It's good and so I like to share with my family and friends, so I deliver them lunches (practically advertising for them) and I get this annoying conversation that I'm like causing ruckus to their business. It makes me not even want to order bc it's the treatment that they give to take-out orders. Clearly, it's not a place that can handle big (or small) company lunches.
author: Mo W.

description: The food more than lived up to how good it looked on Yelp. so good in fact I wasn't even mad it was in a nondescript courtyard of an office building complex. As a tourist I was hoping for a hipper location . I was confused about what SOMA was. But I left satisfied and now I'm wishing they would open a location on Los Angeles' east side.   I like that there are limited option and each is healthier than the next. I had the Original and felt no guilt.
author: Fioni B.

description:
Not worth it.. way to simple, taste is ok. Extremely expensive$$$$
Paid $17.95 (Chicken, steamed veggies, egg, brown rice) and chicken broth aka fat soup = I dont think so! First and Last!
author: Jane D.

description: Best chicken and rice dish ever! This is one of my favorite go-to lunch spots. I love that it includes the broth as well. Definitely comfort food all the way.
author: Amanda C.

description: Very tasty chicken rice! They have several stores in the city and all of them are good. The downtown one is extremely efficient. During workday lunch time they will make a chicken rice every 10 seconds.
author: Ryan C.

description: They serve one dish, but prepare it extremely well. Get the veggies for a well balanced meal.
author: Jacob L.

description: I don't know how they do it, it's simply chicken and rice. But this may be the best thing I've ever eaten. Still having dreams about R&R!
author: Kaitlyn C.

description: Delicious chicken and rice topped with a soy-ginger sauce. My go-to order is the Paleo, but I get it with half brown rice and half veggies instead of the standard veggies-only. It's a bit on the pricier side for a SOMA lunch, but portions are great and it's really hard to find a well-balanced lunchtime meal like this.
author: Matt G.

description: Simple food done well, line can get a bit long but that's a good sign, right?
author: Erik H.

description:
The chicken was very moist, and the rice was good as well.

The hot sauce is DELICIOUS.

The egg is very gooey and mixed in well with rice, and the broth is heaven.

Definitely recommend!
author: Justina H.

description:
you sf-ites have it good, man. burmese stops galore, $4 banh mi, andytown, and khao man gai? i hope u guys give thanks for all the goodness you have

anywho

when i saw that theres a place that does khao man gai i h a d to go. i chanced upon this dish for the first time a few month ago at nong's in portland (bless her soul) and i think its safe to say it kinda changed my life. dont sleep on khao man gai. "room temp chicken" sounds whack but when the sauce is right, such a simple, barebones dish can prove to be one of the most replenishing, fulfilling meals you could enjoy. 

and now reeling back from my philosophical divergence: i ordered the marina with extra vegetables and sauce.

it was ok! the sauce is pungent as it should be. it looked like there was some dried shrimp in the sauce alongside some pepper that added a much-needed kick. the chicken was most definitely not dry, despite it being skinless breast. the brown rice was cooked, all i could ask for. just barely the right amount for a proper chicken:rice ratio. the extra vegetables i got didn't seem to make it to my take-out container? or perhaps a few extra slices of cucumber were the extra vegetable, in which case, the +$2 was definitely not worth it.

regarding the broth, it was nice, but very single note. i expected radishes and some spring onion, additives that would make the broth crisp and refreshing as it had been at nong's. it sorta tasted like low-grade sushi miso soup with some chicken fat incorporated into the base.

eventually the marina + veggies + sauce (had to meet a minimum for the caviar order) rang up to be around $18 with the silly sf tax included. it was nice to fix the khao man gai craving, but not worth that heavy hit to the wallet.

really nice and clean store tho! wish i'd given the original location a try too
author: Angie K.

description: I'm giving 1 star..because I liked the rice and the saucey thing..it was yummy...lets just say I was holding on to dear life for a couple days after eating there..i got sooo sick from the pale chicken....which was suspect...the skin and fat were still uncooked.....of course I didn't want to be rude as I was with coworkers...i had a few bites and couldn't handle it....and my stomach can normally handle anything...and as for the price...yikes...i can buy a whole rotisserie at the grocery store and everything plus the skin would be cooked....for like $5
author: Vicki D.

description: Very tasty but very pricy! Perhaps for frequent customers a rewards card? Every 10 get one free? Would love to come more often but every time I walk out of there it's $15-$18- way beyond my budget for boiled chicken and rice. Don't get me wrong- it's delicious but $$$ - so just once a week for me now!
author: Stan C.

description:
When I heard this place was opening up by my office, I had to check it out after hearing so much about the Marina location. The hype was definitely real and I may have found a new go to spot for lunch in the SoMa!

Don't be fooled by the "plain", simple appearance from the photos...there is a lot to love in the dishes and the atmosphere is pretty spot on (Coke in glass bottles! Hip-Hop music! Fresh Coconuts!)...you really get a feeling the owners/staff take pride in the details, and it shows.

GO TO ROOSTER & RICE!!
author: Mario P.

description: Rooster & Rice is SO delicious! I agree it's a bit pricey, but I'm willing to splurge every once in a while for a healthy, tasty and filling meal. I usually get their Marina with veggies and my husband gets the Original with egg. Perfect meal on a chilly San Francisco day.
author: Erica P.

description: The food here is fantastic. I had never tried Hainan chicken before Rooster & Rice, and now I crave their "Regular" dish with house habanero sauce almost daily. The chicken is somewhat reminiscent of my my mother's Tinola, but it is a wholly different experience. If it weren't for my self-imposed rice restriction, I'd be at R&R every day.
author: Amelia C.

description: Pretty bomb chicken and rice . The sauce is solid and the staff is fun. Can't wait for those stickers!! I'll put it on my laptop!
author: Shirley L.

description: Kao mun gai is one of my favorite Thai dishes and I feel like it's not that common in SF. I've really only had it at the renowned Nong's in Portland. It's been a long time since I've been there so it's hard to compare but Rooster & Rice is certainly quite good. I always order the Original. The chicken feels fresh, tender, and juicy. The rice is super flavorful and most importantly... the sauce is just perfect. The chicken broth is also good.  The reason I'm dropping a star is because I don't think this meal is worth $13. Lunch is consistently less than $10 in the area so it's difficult to justify putting in the weekly lunch rotation. Adding an egg is $2 and a side of 6oz of fried chicken skin is $5. Pricey indeed.  But yeah, it's good. And you should totally try it.
author: Andrew D.

description: I got here at 1120 on a Monday and didn't have to wait in line.  Ordered the chicken with rice and it came with the delicious piping hot soup.  The chicken was good, but not outstanding.  The sauce takes the chicken up a few notches.  The rice is tasty, but texture was a little soft.  Soup was great.  I thought the value was good for a $12 lunch in the City.  As other reviewers indicated, portions are large and could have easily been split into two meals.
author: Yvonne N.

description: Great hainanese chicken place that has delicious food and good execution. I love that you can customize the order and add dark meat if that's your thing, or add a poached egg. It's pricey for what it is (ie. chicken and rice), but it is some of the best you'll have in the area. Be warned, lines can be vicious during rush hours, and you might die of hunger and jealousy as you see others enjoying their food. The fact that every order comes with a soul warming cup of chicken soup broth is just a bonus.
author: David H.

description: Foods good, staff is always friendly, everything about this place is good! I always get the fried chicken skin on the side for the extra .
author: Aaron Y.

description: Food is good ... but I don't appreciate being forgotten... was told that my order would be out in 5 minutes and received my order 20 minutes after I placed it. I normally wouldn't care but only getting a 30 min lunch does the trick. Also pretty pricey
author: George A.

description: Don't understand the rave reviews. If you enjoy bland,  barely lukewarm,  boiled chicken with a skin texture somewhere between slimy and rubbery, pieces of bones and cartilage mixed in, and all that for an outrageous price, then sure,  you're at the right place.  Extra star for the dipping sauce, which was indeed excellent and the only way to get some flavor on the chicken.
author: Eric W.

description:
Has a simple menu but great tasting food. great options like paleo and vegetarian(tofu).

I had the original plate.  chicken was cooked perfectly and sauce was awesome. only drawback.. the rice was a little grainy. taste was great but texture let it down.
author: Andy G.

description: Fast food place that takes 30 min to get your order ready. Tastes great but takes too long to get the food and not cheap.
author: S L.

description: Such good chicken and rice! This was my first stop in SF and its a small little place with only a couple seats. Most people who ordered here were taking to go. The orders come with a small bowl of soup broth which is nice and warm. Really good garlic ginger sauce that goes on the (soft and delicious) rice and chicken. Less stars though because it is really expensive for such a simple dish, though it definitely has to do with the area that they are in.
author: Suzan A.

description: Delicious chicken and rice but one caveat: their service is slow and you'll have to wait a while to get your order. I waited around 10 minutes -- but they only make one thing (chicken and rice, duh!) So I'm confused why it would take so long. It's a simple meal. With that being said, I still think it's tender, juicy and hits the spot. Good comfort food and it's the best option around this area in Soma!
author: Lauren L.

description: I am so glad more Asian food place opened in the SOMA area. This place is pretty new and I have been there a couple of times already. They give you a good portion of chicken. The chicken and rice taste very good mixed in with their sweet soy sauce. Down side is that it is a bit pricey! You can get skinless chicken breast which seems healthy.
author: Jennifer K.

description:
This would be a five-star review if they offered a less expensive option that contained a smaller portion of chicken for those of us with daintier appetites. 

It's about as good as the famous Nong's Khao Man Gai in PDX (which I've been to several times) but the portion sizes are ridiculously large at Rice and Rooster relative to Nong's default size (twice as much chicken -- too much!). 

Rice and Rooster is reat value if you can eat it all in one sitting or split with another person; not so great if you can't, especially if you won't be getting home anytime soon and have no safe place to store any leftovers. 

Rice and Rooster, you have a genuinely wonderful Khao Man Gai. The chicken is super tender; the sauce is incredibly flavorful, but can you please offer a more affordable, smaller portioned option? Please, please? Pretty please, with a cherry on top?

I would be everlastingly grateful and visit much more often if you did :D. Otherwise, I will only visit if I have a dining companion willing to split/share, as the default is more than enough for two people. On that note, anyone who complains that the portions are "too small" is a dope. They practically dump in half a chicken per order. Almost.
author: Maya B.

description: Order The Original. Boring flavors. They charged two dollars for six pieces of broccoli. The sauce it came with was pretty good. Decent amount of food.
author: Kevin S.

description: Decent price but doesn't feel that authentic. Not the biggest fan of the consistency of the rice.
author: Alison D.

description: Really over priced for pretty simple chicken and rice, not unique or flavorful enough to merit the $$$. Do not recommend.
author: Brittney B.

description: Really tender chicken.  Good portions.  Broccoli needs to be steamed a little more because it's almost raw.  Sauce should not cost extra if you want more because the chicken doesn't taste good without it.  Otherwise, great place and please add evening hours.
author: Apple M.

description: The service I received at Rooster and Rice from David and Eugene was exceptional. David started off by recommending his favorite - the original, and Eugene HIGHLY recommended me to add an egg. My belly thanks them for it. 10/10 would come back again!
author: Tony L.

description: The food itself was simple, but very good and healthy. Chicken was moist and the broth was delicious. However, waiting almost 20 minutes for lunch was not ideal. Perhaps it was just the day, but for how basic the menu is, it doesn't make much sense why I would have to wait so long.
author: Matt F.

description:
Really good chicken and rice that is flavorful, moist, and yummy.  It even makes up for the fact there is really no place to sit.

The condiments compliment the chicken and vegetables and bring out even more umami-goodness which is fantastic.

The price is a little on the high side but I would come here again.
author: Patrick C.

description: I ordered The Original near closing time on a Friday. Having missed my lunch during normal hours, I was starving and found the first bite of the chicken to be gratifying. The ginger sauce, the poached egg yolk, and the well-brined chicken breast with skin, topped with a few drips of habanero sauce, made for an amazing combination. Within 10 minutes, I had finished everything and washed down the food with the chicken broth, leaving me feeling very happy about the meal.
author: Hank F.

description: Great concept and spot for those longing for a chicken and rice meal similar to what you might find in a hawker market. You pay a premium and the chicken was a bit dry.
author: Aaron V.

description: Yup. It's good. I got the original, but next time I think I'll try the paleo as there was a LOT of rice in the original. It's not cheap but the portions are huge and it can easily be split between two. It would be great if they offered a half order.
author: El B.

description: It's kind of pricey for just "chicken and rice", but they make it super delicious and healthy. The chicken is juicy and the jasmine rice is really nice. The sauce brings it all together really well.
author: Tan W.

description: Food is so yummy here! Chicken is super tender and the sauce makes a heavenly combo by adding the perfect flavor. The place is quite small but there's ample seating outside. They also have some additional bomb sauces you can add including a Thai chili sauce and mango habanero sauce. Not to mention they have super friendly workers and great service. Eugene was our cashier and he was really helpful in explaining the items and he's also super cute! Would definitely come back.
author: Y C.

description: This review is strictly for the vegetarians, because I desperately wanted to love this place despite all the red flags, i.e. the restaurant name and logo, that this place was not intended for our kind.  They were so nice, and the aesthetic is awesome, and the people outside munching on their chicken seemed so happy. But. There is no amount of special sauce and veggie broth in the world that can make a box of lukewarm, unseasoned tofu and steamed broccoli into a delicious treat for me :(
author: saru k.

description: Was recommend by a co-worker.  I liked my lunch today, the original with extra cucumbers.  The line is out the door and the space is packed with people waiting for their order.  The flavors of the sauce was amazing.  Wish I had more of it though.
author: Mello M.

description: The food is really good, comfort food type stuff. When I first ordered, I was given the wrong meal, but the dude was really gracious about it when I told them. I'm gonna miss this when I don't work in the city anymore but I definitely recommend.
author: Prags S.

description: This is probably the closest thing to hainan chicken if that's what you're looking for. The place is small, limited seating and a few tables outside. Only a few choices to choose from. Meals come with rice, chicken, broth and their special dipping sauce for the chicken. The amount of chicken I got was not a lot for the price I paid but then again it's SF...And my chicken was chopped up in tiny bits, I think it might have been the leftovers from previous chicken. I wasn't completely full afterwards and the taste of the chicken was bland without the sauce. Extra sauce is 1$z I wouldn't come here again unless friends want try it.
author: Vicky C.

description: Second location, original is in the Marina.  Happy to have this addition to the SoMa area.  Go-to healthy, nutritious comfort food. Tender, well-prepared Thai Chicken Rice with a few variations including skinless, vegetables instead of rice, etc.  Sauce is fantastic (get extra) and the broth is a tasty way to wash it down.
author: J M.
